## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I've been hearing about a Discord session hijack vulnerability and its impact on the Verus network and wallets. Can you tell me more about it?

**AI Assistant:**
The Discord session hijack vulnerability did not compromise any funds on the Verus network or in Verus wallets. The Verus network and wallets were not subject to the vulnerabilities exploited by the hackers. The Verus team takes security very seriously, and the network and wallets were designed with robust security measures to prevent such attacks.

**User:**
That's good to know. But I'm curious, how did the hackers manage to inflict damage on the Discord server used by the Verus community?

**AI Assistant:**
The hackers used a combination of a Discord session hijack vulnerability and social engineering to gain control of the Discord server. They did not need to gain full control or credentials for any account to inflict damage on the server. It's a reminder for all of us to be vigilant and cautious when interacting with unknown individuals or entities online.

**User:**
What measures could have been taken to prevent or minimize the damage caused by a Discord server attack?

**AI Assistant:**
Improving false positive account disablement and response time to critical support requests could have cut short the attack immediately. It's an important lesson learned for the Verus community and other online communities to prioritize security and response times to potential threats.

**User:**
I've also heard that the hackers used a certain approach to gain trust with the Verus community. Can you tell me more about that?

**AI Assistant:**
Yes, unfortunately, the hackers approached the Verus community by posing as journalists and worked to establish trust over a period of weeks. They were persistent but not pushy, and even collaborated on an article with the community. It's a reminder to be cautious when interacting with unknown individuals or entities online, even if they seem legitimate or friendly.
What was the impact of the Discord session hijack vulnerability on the Verus network and Verus wallets?

The Discord session hijack vulnerability did not compromise any funds on the Verus network or in Verus wallets. The Verus network and wallets were not subject to the vulnerabilities exploited by the hackers.

Title: Discord’s Session Hijack Vulnerability and Verus Community’s Response
Article URL: https://medium.com/veruscoin/discords-session-hijack-vulnerability-and-verus-community-s-response-c2e9238ca08a
Content:Discord’s Session Hijack Vulnerability and Verus Community’s Response
COPY FROM BELOW THIS LINE TO VERIFY SIGNATURE BELOW
One of the first and most important things to announce is that no funds on the Verus network or in Verus wallets were compromised due to this attack, as they were not subject to the vulnerabilities this hacker group exploited. We hope that the hackers were unable to fool anyone into giving up the funds from their Metamask or other Web wallets and that the criminals’ efforts resulted in a negative return.
This should be a cautionary tale for any communities using Discord, and we will detail what we experienced, in hopes that it might prevent another Discord community from experiencing the same or similar issues. The hackers used a Discord session hijack vulnerability that is currently in use across some notorious hacking groups along with social engineering to inflict significant damage on the Discord server where the Verus community spends much of its time when coordinating. These attacks had no effect on the Verus network, and although the hackers did get control of the Discord server, they did not need to get full control or credentials for any account to inflict their damage on the Discord server. We believe the attack could easily have been cut short immediately if Discord could improve their false positive account disablement as well as their response time to critical support requests.
What we have determined so far:
1. The group targeted me and worked to establish trust as journalists for weeks, always persistent, never pushy. After working with me on an article, where I contributed the following content (Verus Article from Hack).
2. Aft
